intro: Strobilanthes angustifrons, commonly known as the narrow-leaved makepeace, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking clusters of tubular, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is a subject of interest in both horticulture and conservation efforts.
